translations.text: Then Allah graced us with His favour and saved us from the chastisement of the scorching wind.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "So Allah has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of the Fire."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But Allah hath been gracious unto us and hath preserved us from the torment of the breath of Fire.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But Allah showed us favour and He saved us from the punishment of the [infernal] miasma.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: but Allah has been gracious to us and has protected us from the punishment of the burning wind.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: But God has granted us favors and saved us from the scorching heat of the torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But Allah has been gracious to us and He has saved us from the punishment of the hot wind:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Famanna Allahu AAalayna wawaqana AAathaba alssamoomi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God has been gracious to us and has saved us from the torment of Hell's intense heat --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "But Allah has been good to us, and has delivered us from the Penalty of the Scorching Wind.

verses.text: إِنَّا کُنَّا مِنْ‌ قَبْلُ‌ نَدْعُوهُ‌ إِنَّهُ‌ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: از پیش او را [برای نجات از عذاب] می خواندیم؛ زیرا که او نیکوکار و مهربان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما پيش از اين او را مى‌خوانديم، كه او احسان‌كننده و مهربان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به راستى ما پيش از اين او را مى‌خوانديم [و مى‌پرستيديم‌] بى‌ترديد او نيكى‌رسان و مهربان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ما از ديرباز او را مى‌خوانديم، كه او همان نيكوكار مهربان است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: زیرا ما از این پیش خدا را به حقیقت پرستش می‌کردیم که او خود (بر بندگانش) بسیار نیکخواه و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما پیش از این (در جهان، تنها) او را به فریاد می‌خواندیم و فقط وی را پرستش می‌کردیم. واقعاً او نیکوکار و مهربان است. [[«نَدْعُوهُ»: بفریادش می‌خواندیم. او را می‌پرستیدیم. «الْبَرُّ»: نیکوکار (نگا: روح‌المعانی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ما پیش از این او را [به دعا و نیایش‌] می‌خواندیم، اوست که نیکوکار مهربان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما از پیش او را می‌خواندیم (و می‌پرستیدیم)، که اوست نیکوکار و مهربان!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که ما بودیم از پیش می‌خواندیمش همانا او است نکوکار مهربان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: زيرا ما پيش از اين او را مى‌خوانديم، كه اوست نيكوكار و مهربان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «ما بی‌گمان از دیرباز او را می‌خواندیم، که او، (هم)او بس نیکویِ رحمتگر بر ویژگان است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We used to pray to Him erstwhile; He is the just and merciful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Indeed we used to worship Him in our previous life; indeed He only is the Benign, the Most Merciful.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: we were before ever calling upon Him; surely He is the All-benign, the All-compassionate.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily we were wont to pray Unto Him aforetime; verily He! it is He, the Benign, the Merciful.'

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Verily, We used to invoke Him (Alone and none else) before. Verily, He is Al-Barr (the Most Subtle, Kind, Courteous, and Generous), the Most Merciful."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Before this, we used to pray to Him. He is the Good, the Compassionate.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Formerly we had always prayed to Him. Surely He is Most Benign, Most Compassionate.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Verily, We used to invoke Him before. Verily, He is the Most Subtle, the Most Merciful."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! we used to pray unto Him of old. Lo! He is the Benign, the Merciful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We used to supplicate Him aforetime. Indeed He is the All-benign, the All-merciful.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Before, we were supplicating to Him. He is the Giving, the Most Merciful'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, we used to supplicate Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We had prayed to Him; He is Kind and All-merciful".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely we called upon Him before: Surely He is the Benign, the Merciful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna kunna min qablu nadAAoohu innahu huwa albarru alrraheemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: before this, we used to pray to Him. Surely, He is the Beneficent, the Merciful."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Truly, we did call unto Him from of old: truly it is He, the Beneficent, the Merciful!"

verses.text: فَذَکِّرْ فَمَا أَنْتَ‌ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّکَ‌ بِکَاهِنٍ‌ وَ لاَ مَجْنُونٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [مشرکان را] هشدار ده که تو به لطف و رحمت پروردگارت نه کاهنی نه دیوانه؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پندشان ده، كه تو به بركت نعمت پروردگارت نه كاهن هستى و نه مجنون.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس تذكر ده كه تو به لطف پروردگارت نه كاهنى و نه ديوانه

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس اندرز ده كه تو به لطف پروردگارت نه كاهنى و نه ديوانه.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (ای رسول ما، خلق را) متذکر ساز که به نعمت پروردگارت از جنون و کهانت هیچ در تو نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (مردمان را به قرآن) پند و اندرز بده، تو در پرتو لطف و مرحمت پروردگارت نه غیبگوئی و نه دیوانه. [[«ذَکِّرْ»: پند بده. موعظه کن. «بِنِعْمَةِ»: در پرتو نعمت. به برکت مرحمت. «کَاهِنٍ»: غیبگو. کسی که ادعای علم غیب می‌کند. کسی که خبر از اسرار غیبی می‌دهد و مدعی است که با جنیان و پریان ارتباط دارد و اخبار غیبی را از ایشان می‌گیرد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس پند ده که تو به نعمت پروردگارت نه کاهنی و نه دیوانه‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس تذکّر ده، که به لطف پروردگارت تو کاهن و مجنون نیستی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس یادآوری کن که نیستی تو قسم به نعمت پروردگارت پیش‌گوئی و نه دیوانه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس يادآورى كن و پند ده كه تو به نعمت پروردگارت- به لطف او يا به بركت نعمت نبوت و عصمت- نه كاهنى و نه ديوانه.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس یادآوری(شان) کن که تو به نعمت پروردگارت نه کاهنی و نه دیوانه‌ای.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Remind them, therefore, that by the grace of your Lord you are neither a soothsayer nor possessed.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), enlighten, for by the munificence of your Lord, you are neither a soothsayer nor a madman.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Therefore remind! by thy Lord's blessing thou art not a soothsayer neither possessed.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore admonish thou! thou art not, by the grace of thy Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Therefore, remind and preach (mankind, O Muhammad SAW of Islamic Monotheism). By the Grace of Allah, you are neither a soothsayer, nor a madman.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So remind. By the grace of your Lord, you are neither a soothsayer, nor a madman.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So exhort (them, O Prophet), for by your Lord's Grace, you are neither a soothsayer nor a madman.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Therefore, remind. By the grace of Allah, you are neither a Kahin nor a madman.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor warn (men, O Muhammad). By the grace of Allah thou art neither soothsayer nor madman.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So admonish. By your Lord’s blessing, you are not a soothsayer, nor mad.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Therefore, remind. By the Favor of Allah, you are neither a soothsayer, nor mad.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So remind [O Muhammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), remind them, by the Grace of your Lord, that you are neither a soothsayer or an insane person.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore continue to remind, for by the grace of your Lord, you are not a soothsayer, or a madman.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fathakkir fama anta biniAAmati rabbika bikahin wala majnoonin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Therefore continue to give warning, for by the grace of your Lord, you are not a soothsayer or a madman.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore proclaim thou the praises (of thy Lord): for by the Grace of thy Lord, thou art no (vulgar) soothsayer, nor art thou one possessed.

verses.text: أَمْ‌ يَقُولُونَ‌ شَاعِرٌ نَتَرَبَّصُ‌ بِهِ‌ رَيْبَ‌ الْمَنُونِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بلکه این سبک مغزانند که می گویند: او شاعری است که برای او حوادث تلخ روزگار و آمدن مرگش را انتظار می بردیم!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند: شاعرى است و ما براى وى منتظر حوادث روزگاريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا مى‌گويند: شاعرى است كه ما براى وى منتظر مرگ و حوادث روزگاريم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند: «شاعرى است كه انتظار مرگش را مى‌بريم [و چشم به راه بد زمانه بر اوييم‌].»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه (کافران نادان) گویند: (محمّد) شاعری است ماهر و ما حادثه مرگ او را انتظار داریم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا آنان می‌گویند که او شاعر است (و بگذارید تا زنده است اشعار خود را بسراید و دل مردمانی را برباید) و ما در انتظار مرگ او هستیم (تا دفتر اشعار و طومار عمرش را درهم پیچد و ما را از دست او راحت سازد). [[«شَاعِرٌ»: چامه‌سرا. خبر مبتدای محذوف است و تقدیر چنین است: هُوَ شَاعِرٌ. «نَتَرَبَّصُ»: انتظار می‌کشیم. منتظر هستیم. «رَیْبَ»: شک و گمان. مشکوک. در اینجا مراد نزول و تغییرات است. «الْمَنُونِ»: مرگ. از نظر لغوی، به معنی قطع کننده است. مرگ هم رشته عمر را قطع می‌کند. «رَیْبَ الْمَنُونِ»: گمان مرگ. مرگ مشکوک. با توجه به معنی اخیر، اضافه صفت به موصوف خود است. یعنی مرگی که وقت فرا رسیدنش مورد گمان است و معلوم نیست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر گویند شاعری است که ما در حق او حوادث روزگار [/مرگ‌] را انتظار می‌کشیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بلکه آنها می‌گویند: «او شاعری است که ما انتظار مرگش را می‌کشیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا گویند شاعری است که چشم به راهیم بدو گردش روزگار را (یا پیش‌آمدهای مرگ)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بلكه گويند: شاعرى است كه ما رويداد مرگ را درباره وى چشم مى‌داريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا می‌گویند: «شاعری است (که) بسی انتظار مرگش را می‌بریم (و چشم به راهِ بَدِ زمانه بر اوییم).»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they say: "He is a poet for whom we expect an adverse turn of fortune?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or they allege, “He is a poet – we await a calamity of the times to befall him.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or do they say, 'He is a poet for whom we await Fate's uncertainty'?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or say they: a poet for whom we wait some adverse turn of fortune!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or do they say: "(Muhammad SAW is) a poet! We await for him some calamity by time!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they say, “A poet—we await for him a calamity of time”?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await an adverse turn of fortune.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or do they say: "A poet! We await for him some calamity by time!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or say they: (he is) a poet, (one) for whom we may expect the accident of time?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they say, ‘[He is] a poet, for whom we await a fatal accident’?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or do they say: 'He is a poet, we are waiting for some misfortune to befall him'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they say, "He is only a poet and we are waiting to see him die!?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or do they say: A poet, we wait for him the evil accidents of time.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am yaqooloona shaAAirun natarabbasu bihi rayba almanooni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If they say, "He is but a poet; we are waiting for some misfortune to befall him,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or do they say:- "A Poet! we await for him some calamity (hatched) by Time!"

verses.text: قُلْ‌ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي‌ مَعَکُمْ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: [هلاکت خود را] انتظار برید که من هم با شما از منتظرانم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: شما منتظر بمانيد كه من نيز با شما انتظار مى‌كشم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: منتظر باشيد كه من نيز با شما از منتظرانم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «منتظر باشيد كه من [نيز] با شما از منتظرانم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: شما به انتظار (مرگ من) باشید که من هم از منتظران (مرگ و هلاک شما) هستم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: شما در انتظار (پندارهای خامتان) باشید، و من هم با شما در انتظار (عاقبت نیک خود و سرانجام بد شما) هستم. [[«الْمُتَرَبِّصِینَ»: انتظار کشندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو منتظر باشید که من هم همراه شما از منتظرانم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «انتظار بکشید که من هم با (شما انتظار می‌کشم شما انتظار مرگ مرا، و من انتظار نابودی شما را با عذاب الهی)!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو چشم به راه باشید که منم با شما از چشم به راهان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: چشم بداريد- مرگ مرا- كه من هم چشم مى‌دارم- پيروزى اسلام و نابودى شما را-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: « منتظر باشید، پس من (نیز) با شما از منتظرانم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Tell them: "Keep on expecting, I am expecting with you."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim, “Go on waiting – I too am waiting along with you.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'Await! I shall be awaiting with you.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: waits verily I am, with you, among the waiters.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW to them): "Wait! I am with you, among the waiters!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “Go on waiting; I will be waiting with you.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Tell them: “Wait; I too am waiting with you.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "Wait! I am with you among those who wait!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say (unto them): Except (your fill)! Lo! I am with you among the expectant.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘Wait! I too am waiting along with you.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'Wait if you will; I shall be waiting with you'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am, with you, among the waiters."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Say, "Wait, I too am waiting with you".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: Wait, for surely I too with you am of those who wait.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul tarabbasoo fainnee maAAakum mina almutarabbiseena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: say [to them], "Wait then: I too am waiting along with you!" --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say thou: "Await ye!- I too will wait along with you!"

verses.text: أَمْ‌ تَأْمُرُهُمْ‌ أَحْلاَمُهُمْ‌ بِهٰذَا أَمْ‌ هُمْ‌ قَوْمٌ‌ طَاغُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا عقل هایشان آنان را به این گفتارهای باطل و یاوه [بر ضد تو و قرآن] وا می دارد، یا [نه] آنان مردمی طغیان گر و سرکش اند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آنان را رؤياهايشان به اين پندارها كشانده يا خود مردمى طاغى هستند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا عقل‌هايشان آنها را به اين [موضعگيرى‌] وا مى‌دارد يا آنها مردمى سركش هستند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا پندارهايشان آنان را به اين [موضعگيرى‌] وا مى‌دارد يا [نه،] آنها مردمى سركشند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا زیرکی و خیالات باطلشان بر این وا می‌دارد (که تکذیب تو کنند) یا (از جهل و کبر و نخوت) خود قومی سرکش و نافرمانند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا خردهایشان ایشان را به این (سخنان متناقض) دستور می‌دهد؟ یا این که اصلاً مردمان طغیانگر و سرکشی هستند (و سرپیچی از فرمان حق، سرشت و خصیصه‌ی آنان شده است؟). [[«أحْلام»: جمع حِلْم، خردها و عقلها. «هذا»: این سخنان متناقض. یعنی گاهی پیغمبر را شاعر، گاهی مجنون، زمانی کاهن، و غیره می‌نامند. در صورتی که کاهن و شاعر، خردمند هستند، و مجنون، دیوانه و بی‌خرد است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر خردهایشان آنان را به این امر فرمان می‌دهد، یا مگر ایشان قومی طغیانگرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا عقلهایشان آنها را به این اعمال دستور می‌دهد، یا قومی طغیانگرند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا دستورشان دهد خردهاشان بدین بلکه ایشانند گروهی گردنکش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر خردشان اين را به آنها فرمان مى‌دهد، يا خود مردمى سركش‌اند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا پندارهای خواب‌آلودشان، آنان را به این (موضعگیری) وا می‌دارد یا آنان گروهی سرکشند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Does their reasoning prompt them to this, or they are a people rebellious?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Is this what their senses tell them, or are they a rebellious people?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or do their intellects bid them do this? Or are they an insolent people?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Enjoin them their understandings to this? or are they a people conumacious?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do their minds command them this [i.e. to tell a lie against you (Muhammad SAW)] or are they people exceeding the bounds (i.e. from Belief in Allah to disbelief).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or is it that their dreams compel them to this? Or are they aggressive people?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do their minds prompt them to say such things, or are they a people immersed in transgression?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or do their minds command them this or are they people transgressing all bounds

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Do their minds command them to do this, or are they an outrageous folk?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is it their intellect which prompts them to [say] this, or are they a rebellious lot?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do their intellects order them to do this? Or, are they an insolent people?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do their minds command them to [say] this, or are they a transgressing people?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Does their reason tell them to say this or is it because they are a rebellious people?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay! do their understandings bid them this? Or are they an inordinate people?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am tamuruhum ahlamuhum bihatha am hum qawmun taghoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: is it their minds that prompt them [to say] this, or are they merely insolent people?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is it that their faculties of understanding urge them to this, or are they but a people transgressing beyond bounds?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ يَقُولُونَ‌ تَقَوَّلَهُ‌ بَلْ‌ لاَ يُؤْمِنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا می گویند: قرآن را از پیش خود ساخته [و به خدا نسبت داده است؟ چنین نیست که می پندارند]، بلکه [قرآن وحی الهی است، ولی اینان] ایمان نمی آورند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند: قرآن را خود ساخته است. نه، آنها ايمان نمى‌آورند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند: آن [قرآن‌] را خود ساخته؟ [نه، اينها بهانه است‌] بلكه ايمان نمى‌آورند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند: «آن را بربافته.» [نه،] بلكه باور ندارند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه می‌گویند: او قرآن را از پیش خود فرابافته است (چنین نیست) بلکه آنها ایمان نمی‌آورند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا می‌گویند: (محمّد خودش قرآن را از پیش خود ساخته است و) آن را فراهم آورده است؟! بلکه ایشان اصلاً ایمان ندارند. [[«تَقَوَّلَهُ»: آن را از پیش خود ساخته است و به دروغ به خدا نسبت داده است (نگا: حاقه / 44).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا گویند آن را از خود بربافته است، حق این است که ایمان نمی‌ورزند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا می‌گویند: «قرآن را به خدا افترا بسته»، ولی آنان ایمان ندارند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا گویند پرداختش (پرداخت این سخن را) بلکه ایمان نیارند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بلكه گويند اين

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا می‌گویند: «آن را بربافته.» بلکه ایمان نمی‌آورند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they say: "He has fabricated it?" In fact, they will never believe.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: What! They say, “He has invented the Qur'an”? Rather they do not have faith.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or do they say, 'He has invented it?' Nay, but they do not believe.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or say they: he hath fabricated it: aye they will not believe.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or do they say: "He (Muhammad SAW) has forged it (this Quran)?" Nay! They believe not!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they say, “He made it up”? Rather, they do not believe.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do they say: “He has himself fabricated the Qur'an?” No; the truth is that they are altogether averse to believing.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or do they say: "He has forged it" Nay! They believe not!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or say they: He hath invented it? Nay, but they will not believe!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they say, ‘He has improvised it [himself]?’ Rather, they have no faith!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do they say: 'He has invented it' No, they do not believe.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do they say, "He has made it up"? Rather, they do not believe.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they say, "He has falsely invented it (the Quran)?" In fact, they themselves have no faith.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or do they say: He has forged it. Nay! they do not believe.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am yaqooloona taqawwalahu bal la yuminoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Or do they say, "He has invented it himself"? Indeed, they are not willing to believe.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or do they say, "He fabricated the (Message)"? Nay, they have no faith!

verses.text: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ‌ مِثْلِهِ‌ إِنْ‌ کَانُوا صَادِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس اگر [در ادعای خود] راستگویید، سخنی مانند آن بیاورید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر راست مى‌گويند، سخنى مانند آن بياورند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس بايد سخنى مانند آن بياورند اگر راست مى‌گويند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس اگر راست مى‌گويند، سخنى مثل آن بياورند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس اگر راست می‌گویند آنها هم کلامی مانند قرآن بیاورند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر راست می‌گویند (که محمّد خودش قرآن را از پیش خود ساخته است) سخنی همچون آن را بیاورند و ارائه دهند. [[«فَلْیَأْتُوا بِحَدِیثٍ مِّثْلِهِ ...»: (نگا: بقره / 23، یونس / 38، هود / 13، اسراء / 88).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس اگر راستگو هستند سخنی مانند آن بیاورند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اگر راست می‌گویند سخنی همانند آن بیاورند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بیارند داستانی همانندش اگر هستند راستگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس سخنى مانند اين بيارند، اگر راستگويند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس اگر (از) راستان بوده‌اند، سخنی همانند آن بیاورند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So let them bring a discourse like it, if they are truthful

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So let them bring a single discourse like it, if they are truthful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then let them bring a discourse like it, if they speak truly.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Let them bring a discourse like thereUnto, if they say sooth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Let them then produce a recital like unto it (the Quran) if they are truthful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So let them produce a discourse like it, if they are truthful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (If they are truthful in this), then let them produce a discourse of similar splendour.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Let them then produce a recitation like unto it if they are truthful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then let them produce speech the like thereof, if they are truthful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Let them bring a discourse like it, if they are truthful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Let them produce a phrase like it, if what they say is true!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then let them produce a statement like it, if they should be truthful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Let them produce a discourse like it if they are true in their claim.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then let them bring an announcement like it if they are truthful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falyatoo bi<u>h</u>adeethin mithlihi in k<u>a</u>noo <u>sa</u>diqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Let them produce a scripture like it, if what they say is true.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Let them then produce a recital like unto it,- If (it be) they speak the truth!

verses.text: أَمْ‌ خُلِقُوا مِنْ‌ غَيْرِ شَيْ‌ءٍ أَمْ‌ هُمُ‌ الْخَالِقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا آنان از غیر [آن] چیزی [که دیگران را از آن آفریده اند،] آفریده شده اند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا بى‌هيچ خالقى پديد آمده‌اند يا خود خالق خويشند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا آنها از هيچ [و بى‌هيچ خالقى‌] خلق شده‌اند يا خود خالق [خويش‌] اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا از هيچ خلق شده‌اند؟ يا آنكه خودشان خالق [خود] هستند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا این خلق (بدون خالق) از نیستی صرف به وجود آمدند؟ یا (خویشتن را) خود خلق کردند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا ایشان (همین جوری از عدم سر بر آورده‌اند و) بدون هیچ گونه خالقی آفریده شده‌اند؟ و یا این که (خودشان خویشتن را آفریده‌اند و) خودشان آفریدگارند؟ [[«مِنْ غَیْرِ شَیْءٍ»: بدون هیچ چیزی و هیچ آفریدگاری. یعنی بدون علت به وجود آمده‌اند. «أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ»: یعنی خودشان آفریدگار، و علت خویشتن هستند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا از هیچ خلق شده‌اند، یا آنکه خودشان خالق [خود]اند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا آنها بی هیچ آفریده شده‌اند، یا خود خالق خویشند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا آفریده شدند بی چیزی یا ایشانند آفرینندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر از هيچ آفريده شده‌اند- بى‌آفريدگارى- يا خود آفريننده [خويش‌] اند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا از هیچ خلق شده‌اند یا آنکه خودشان آفریدگار (خود)ند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or were they created of themselves? Or are they the creators?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Have they not been created from some source, or are they themselves the creators?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or were they created out of nothing? Or are they the creators?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Have they not been created by aught, or are they the creators?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Were they created by nothing, or were they themselves the creators?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or were they created out of nothing? Or are they the creators?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did they come into being without any creator? Or were they their own creators?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or were they created by nothing Or were they themselves the creators

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or were they created out of naught? Or are they the creators?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Were they created from nothing? Or are they [their own] creators?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, were they created out of nothing? Or, were they their own creators?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or were they created by nothing, or were they the creators [of themselves]?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have they been created from nothing or are they themselves their own creators?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or were they created without there being anything, or are they the creators?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am khuliqoo min ghayri shayin am humu alkhaliqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Were they created out of nothing, or are they their own creators?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Were they created of nothing, or were they themselves the creators?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضَ‌ بَلْ‌ لاَ يُوقِنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یاآنان آسمان ها و زمین را آفریده اند؟ نه، بلکه یقین ندارند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا آسمانها و زمين را خلق كرده‌اند؟ نه، به يقين نرسيده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر آسمان‌ها و زمين را آنها خلق كرده‌اند [كه فرمان نپذيرند]؟ بلكه جوياى يقين نيستند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا آسمانها و زمين را [آنان‌] خلق كرده‌اند؟ [نه،] بلكه يقين ندارند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا آنکه آسمانها و زمین را این مردم آفریدند؟ نه، بلکه به یقین (خدا را) نشناختند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که آنان آسمانها و زمین را آفریده‌اند؟! بلکه ایشان طالب یقین نیستند. [[«لا یُوقِنُونَ»: به یقین و باور نرسیده‌اند و هنوز سرگشته‌اند. جویا و خواستار یقین نیستند و در پی ایمان به وحدانیت خدا نمی‌باشند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا آسمانها و زمین را آفریده‌اند، حق این است که یقین نمی‌ورزند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا آنها آسمانها و زمین را آفریده‌اند؟! بلکه آنها جویای یقین نیستند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا آفریدند آسمانها و زمین را بلکه ایشان یقین ندارند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر آسمانها و زمين را آفريده‌اند؟! [نه،] بلكه به يقين نرسيده‌اند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا آسمان‌ها و زمین را (هم) خلق کرده‌اند؟ (نه)، بلکه یقین ندارند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or have they created the heavens and the earth? In fact they are certain of nothing.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather they are not certain.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and earth? Nay, but they have not sure faith.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Created they the heavens and the earth! Aye! they will not be convinced.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they have no firm Belief.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? In fact, they are not certain.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or is it they who created the heavens and the earth? No; the truth is that they lack sure faith.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth Nay, but they have no firm belief.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they are sure of nothing!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they have no certainty!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, did they create the heavens and the earth? No, their belief is not certain!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have they created the heavens and the earth? In fact, they have no strong faith.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay! they have no certainty.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am khalaqoo alssamawati waalarda bal la yooqinoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Did they create the heavens and the earth? No! They have no faith.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, they have no firm belief.

verses.text: أَمْ‌ عِنْدَهُمْ‌ خَزَائِنُ‌ رَبِّکَ‌ أَمْ‌ هُمُ‌ الْمُسَيْطِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا خزانه های [علم و قدرت] پروردگارت نزد آنان است [که هر کس را اینان به پیامبری برگزینند، پیامبر است و چون تو را پیامبر نمی دانند، پس پیامبر نیستی؟] یا بر تدبیر امور هستی و بر خدا مسلط اند [که اگر بخواهند این مقام را از تو سلب کنند، بتوانند؟]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا خزاين پروردگارت نزد آنهاست؟ يا بر چيزى تسلط يافته‌اند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا ذخاير پروردگار تو نزد آنهاست يا ايشان [بر جهان هستى‌] تسلط دارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا ذخاير پروردگار تو پيش آنهاست؟ يا ايشان تسلط [تام‌] دارند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا گنجهای رحمت پروردگارت نزد آنهاست یا هیچ قدرت و سلطنتی دارند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا گنجینه‌های پروردگارت نزد ایشان و در اختیار آنان است (تا هر گونه که بخواهند قضاوت کنند و نبوّت را به این بدهند و به آن ندهند؟) یا این که ایشان (بر همه چیز جهان) سیطره دارند (و ارباب و فرمانده کلّ کائنات هستند؟). [[«الْمُصَیْطِرُونَ»: جمع مُصَیْطِر، مسلط و توانا. غالب و چیره. مُصَیْطِر و مُسَیْطِر یکی است (نگا: غاشیه / 22). علت تبدیل (س) به (ص) به سبب حرف استعلاء (ط) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا گنجینه‌های پروردگارت نزد آنهاست، یا آنان چیرگانند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا خزاین پروردگارت نزد آنهاست؟! یا بر همه چیز عالم سیطره دارند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا نزد ایشان است گنجهای پروردگار تو یا ایشانند فرمانفرمایان (فرمانروایان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر گنجينه‌هاى پروردگارت نزد آنهاست؟!- كه نبوت را به هر كه خواهند بدهند- يا خود چيره‌دست‌اند- كه نبوت را از هر كه خواهند بازدارند-؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا ذخایر پروردگار تو نزد آنهاست‌؟ یا (هم)ایشان تسلّط (تامّ بر آنها) دارند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord? Or are they the treasurers?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or do they have the treasures of your Lord, or are they the authority?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or are thy Lord's treasuries in their keeping? Or are they the registrars?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Are with them the treasures of thy Lord! or are they the dispensers?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or are with them the treasures of your Lord? Or are they the tyrants with the authority to do as they like?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they possess the treasuries of your Lord? Or are they the controllers?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or do they have your Lord's treasures in their keeping? Or have absolute authority over them?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or are with them the treasures of your Lord Or are they the tyrants with the authority to do as they like

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or do they own the treasures of thy Lord? Or have they been given charge (thereof)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they possess the treasuries of your Lord? Or do they control [them]?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, are the treasures of your Lord in their keeping? Or, are they the controllers?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord? Or are they the controllers [of them]?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they own the treasures of your Lord? Have they any authority over God?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have they the treasures of your Lord with them? Or have they been set in absolute authority?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am AAindahum khazainu rabbika am humu almusaytiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they own the treasures of your Lord, or have they been given charge of them?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or are the Treasures of thy Lord with them, or are they the managers (of affairs)?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ سُلَّمٌ‌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ‌ فِيهِ‌ فَلْيَأْتِ‌ مُسْتَمِعُهُمْ‌ بِسُلْطَانٍ‌ مُبِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا برای آنان نردبانی است که [بر آن برشوند و] در آن خبرهای غیبی را بشنوند؟ پس باید شنونده اش دلیلی آشکار [بر ادعایش] بیاورد؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا نردبامى دارند كه از آن بالا مى‌روند و گوش فرامى‌دهند؟ پس آن كه گوش فراداده حجتى آشكار بياورد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا آنها نردبانى دارند در آن [اخبار غيبى را] مى‌شنوند؟ پس بايد شنونده‌ى آنان برهانى آشكار بياورد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا نردبانى دارند كه بر آن [بر شوند و] بشنوند؟ پس بايد شنونده آنان برهانى آشكار بياورد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا نردبامی دارند که به آسمان بر شوند و (سخن وحی فرشتگان) بشنوند؟ اگر چنین است شنونده‌شان حجت روشن بیاورد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا نردبانی دارند و بالای آن (می‌روند و در آسمانها، به عالم ملکوت) گوش فرا می‌دارند (و اسرار وحی را می‌شنوند؟). گوش فرا دهنده‌ی ایشان دلیل روشنی بیاورد و ارائه دهد (و این ادّعای خود را ثابت کند). [[«سُلَّمٌ»: نردبان. «سُلْطَانٍ مُّبِینٍ»: دلیل و برهان روشن. دلیل و برهان بیانگر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا نردبانی دارند که [بر آن بالا رفته‌] [اسرار را] با آن می‌شنوند، در این صورت شنونده آنان دلیلی آشکار بیاورد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا نردبانی دارند (که به آسمان بالا می‌روند) و بوسیله آن اسرار وحی را می‌شنوند؟! کسی که از آنها این ادّعا را دارد دلیل روشنی بیاورد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا آنان را است نردبانی که بشنوند بر آن پس بیارد شنونده ایشان به فرمانروائی آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر آنان را نردبانى است كه با آن [به آسمان برشده خبرهاى وحى را] مى‌شنوند؟! پس بايد كه شنونده‌شان حجتى روشن و هويدا بيارد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا نردبانی دارند که در آن می‌شنوند؟ پس باید شنونده‌ی آنان برهانی آشکارگر بیاورد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they have a ladder (climbing which) they can hear (the secrets of heaven)? Let one who has heard then bring a clear proof.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or do they have any stairs, climbing upon which they eavesdrop? So their eavesdropper should bring some clear proof!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or have they a ladder whereon they listen? Then let any of them that has listened bring a clear authority.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Have they a stairway whereby they overhear? Then let their listener bring an authority manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or have they a stairway (to heaven), by means of which they listen (to the talks of the angels)? Then let their listener produce some manifest proof.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they have a stairway by means of which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear proof.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or do they have a ladder whereon they can climb and attempt to listen (to what is transpiring in the Higher Realm)? Then, let any of them who has listened to it produce a clear proof of it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or have they a stairway (to heaven), by means of which they listen Then let their listener produce some manifest proof.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or have they any stairway (unto heaven) by means of which they overhear (decrees). Then let their listener produce some warrant manifest!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they have a ladder [leading up to heaven] whereby they eavesdrop? If so, let their eavesdropper produce a manifest authority.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do they have a ladder on which they listen? Then let any of them that has listened bring a clear authority.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear authority.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they have a ladder (by which they can climb up to the heavens) and listen (to the angels) and come back to the rest of the people with clear authority?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have they the means by which they listen? Then let their listener bring a clear authority.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am lahum sullamun yastamiAAoona feehi falyati mustamiAAuhum bisultanin mubeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have they a ladder up to heaven by means of which they can overhear? Then let their listeners bring a clear proof.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or have they a ladder, by which they can (climb up to heaven and) listen (to its secrets)? Then let (such a) listener of theirs produce a manifest proof.

verses.text: أَمْ‌ لَهُ‌ الْبَنَاتُ‌ وَ لَکُمُ‌ الْبَنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا سهم خدا دختران است و سهم شما پسران؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا خداوند را دختران است و شما را پسران؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا خداوند را دختران است و شما را پسران [كه فرشتگان را دختران خدا مى‌ناميد]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا خدا را دختران است و شما را پسران؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا خدا را دختران و شما را پسران خواهد بود (که ملایک را دختران خدا دانید).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا دختران، سهم خدایند، و پسران، سهم شما؟! [[«لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ»: دختر و پسر از نظر ارزش انسانی با هم تفاوتی ندارند، و تعبیر آیه، در حقیقت از قبیل استدلال به عقیده باطل طرف مخالف بر ضد خود او است. و آن این که عربها به شدت از دختر بیزار بودند، و با وجود این زادگان خدا را دختر می‌دانستند (نگا: نحل / 57، زخرف / 17، صافات / 149).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر او [خداوند] را دختران و شما را پسران است؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا سهم خدا دختران است و سهم شما پسران (که فرشتگان را دختران خدا می‌نامید)؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا او را است دختران و شما را است پسران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر او

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا خدا را دختران است و شما را پسران؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Has (God) daughters and they sons?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: What! The daughters for Him, and the sons for you?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or has He daughters, and they sons?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Hath He daughters and ye sons?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or has He (Allah) only daughters and you have sons?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or for Him the daughters, and for you the sons?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or does Allah have daughters whereas you have sons?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or has He only daughters and you have sons

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or hath He daughters whereas ye have sons?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Does He have daughters while you have sons?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, has He daughters, and they sons?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or has He daughters while you have sons?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do the daughters belong to Him and the sons to you?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or has He daughters while you have sons?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am lahu albanatu walakumu albanoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Does God have daughters while you have sons?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or has He only daughters and ye have sons?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ تَسْأَلُهُمْ‌ أَجْراً فَهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ مَغْرَمٍ‌ مُثْقَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا از آنان [در برابرابلاغ رسالت] پاداشی می خواهی که از خسارت آن سنگین بارند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا از آنها مزدى مى‌طلبى و پرداخت غرامت بر آنها دشوار است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا از آنها مزدى مى‌خواهى كه ايشان از غرامت [آن‌] سنگين بارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا از آنها مزدى مطالبه مى‌كنى و آنان از [تعهّد اداى‌] تاوان گرانبارند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا تو (ای رسول) از آنها اجر رسالت خواهی که زیر بار سنگین غرامت بمانند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که تو از آنان اجر و پاداشی (در مقابل ابلاغ رسالت خود بدیشان) میخواهی، و همچون بار گرانی بر دوش آنان سنگینی می‌کند؟ [[«مَغْرَمٍ»: غرامت. زیان. تاوان. خسارت (نگا: توبه / 98). مصدر میمی است. «مُثْقَلُونَ»: سنگین باران. بار گرانان. از مصدر (إثقال) به معنی تحمیل مشقت و بار گران است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر از ایشان مزدی می‌طلبی، و ایشان از تاوانی گرانبارند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا تو از آنها پاداشی می‌طلبی که در زیر بار گران آن قرار دارند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا پرسیشان پاداشی پس ایشانند از هزینه سنگین‌باران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر از آنان مزدى مى‌خواهى كه از تاوان آن گرانبارند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا از آنها مزدی مطالبه می‌کنی، پس آنان از (تعهّد ادای) تاوانی گرانبارند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do you demand any wages from them so that they are burdened with expense?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or do you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) ask any fee from them, so they are burdened with the penalty?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or askest thou them for a wage, and so they are weighed down with debt?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or askest thou a hire from them so that they are with debt laden?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or is it that you (O Muhammad SAW) ask a wage from them (for your preaching of Islamic Monotheism) so that they are burdened with a load of debt?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do you demand a payment from them, and they are burdened by debt?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or is it that you ask of them any recompense so that they should fear to be weighed down under the burden of debt?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or is it that you ask a wage from them so that they are burdened with a load of debt

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or askest thou (Muhammad) a fee from them so that they are plunged in debt?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do you ask them for a reward, so that they are [wary of] being weighed down with debt?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do you ask them for a wage, so that they become weighed down in debt?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you (Muhammad) ask them for any payment (for your preaching) which they cannot afford?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or do you ask them for a reward, so that they are overburdened by a debt?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am tasaluhum ajran fahum min maghramin muthqaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Or do you ask them for a reward, so that they are over-burdened by debt?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or is it that thou dost ask for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-

verses.text: أَمْ‌ عِنْدَهُمُ‌ الْغَيْبُ‌ فَهُمْ‌ يَکْتُبُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا علم غیب نزد آنان است که آنان [ادعای خود را از روی آن] می نویسند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا علم غيب مى‌دانند و مى‌نويسند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا اسرار غيب نزد آنهاست و آنها مى‌نويسند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا [علم‌] غيب پيش آنهاست و آنها مى‌نويسند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا علم غیب با آنهاست که از آن عالم خبری نگارند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که نزد ایشان، علم غیبیّات و اسرار نهان (جهان و ملکوت یزدان) است و از روی آن (برای مردم هر چه بخواهند) می‌نویسند؟ [[«أَمْ عِندَهُمُ الْغَیْبُ؟»: آیا آنان غیب می‌دانند؟ آیا دانش اسرار نهان و علم غیب در پیش آنان است؟]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر غیب در اختیار آنان است و ایشان [هر چه خواهند] می‌نویسند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا اسرار غیب نزد آنهاست و از روی آن می‌نویسند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا نزد ایشان است ناپیدا پس ایشان می‌نویسند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر دانش نهان نزدشان است كه [از آنجا] مى‌نويسند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا (علم) غیب نزد آنهاست‌، پس آنان (آن را) می‌نویسند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they have knowledge of the Unknown which they write down?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or is the hidden with them, by which they pass judgements?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or is the Unseen in their keeping, and so they are writing it down?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is with them the Unseen, and they write it down!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or that the Ghaib (unseen) is with them, and they write it down?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they know the future, and they are writing it down?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or is it that they have access to (the Truths in) the realm beyond sense-perception which they are writing down?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or that the Unseen is with them, and they write it down

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or possess they the Unseen so that they can write (it) down?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they have [access to] the Unseen, which they write down?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, is the Unseen in their keeping, so they are writing it down?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they have knowledge of the unseen, thus, are able to predict (the future)?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have they the unseen so that they write (it) down?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am AAindahumu alghaybu fahum yaktuboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they possess knowledge of the unseen, so that they can write it down?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or that the Unseen in it their hands, and they write it down?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ يُرِيدُونَ‌ کَيْداً فَالَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا هُمُ‌ الْمَکِيدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا می خواهند [بر ضد تو] نیرنگ و فریبی به کار گیرند؟ ولی کافران [بدانند که] خود اسیر و محکوم نیرنگ شده اند. ….

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا مى‌خواهند حيلتى كنند؟ اما كافران خود به حيلت گرفتارند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا مى‌خواهند نيرنگى بزنند؟ ولى كافران خودشان نيرنگ خورده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا مى‌خواهند نيرنگى بزنند؟ و [لى‌] آنان كه كافر شده‌اند، خود دچار نيرنگ شده‌اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا که می‌خواهند با تو مکر و تزویری اندیشند؟ کافران خود به مکر (و انتقام حق) گرفتارند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که می‌خواهند نیرنگ بزنند (و طرحهای شیطانی بریزند و حیله‌گری کنند، تا پیغمبر را از میان بردارند، یا با آئین او مقابله کنند. باید بدانند که) کفّار به حیلت خود گرفتار می‌آیند (و توطئه‌های ایشان سرانجام بر ضدّ خودشان تمام می‌شود و جملگی ایشان محکوم نقشه‌های الهی هستند). [[«کَیْداً»: نیرنگ. حیله‌گری. توطئه. نقشه سوء (نگا: آل‌عمران / 54). «الْمَکِیدُونَ»: گرفتاران نیرنگ. شکست خوردگان توطئه (نگا: فاطر / 43، انفال / 30).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر نیرنگی در سر دارند، ولی کافران خود نیرنگ خورده‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا می‌خواهند نقشه شیطانی برای تو بکشند؟! ولی بدانند خود کافران در دام این نقشه‌ها گرفتار می‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا خواهند نیرنگی را پس آنان که کفر ورزیدند ایشانند فریب‌دادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر نيرنگى- درباره تو- مى‌خواهند؟! ولى كافران خود گرفتار نيرنگ‌اند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا می‌خواهند نیرنگی بزنند؟پس آنان که کافر شده‌اند، خودشان دچار نیرنگند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they want to stage a deception? -- Then only those who do not believe will be the ones who will be tricked.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or are they planning a conspiracy? So the conspiracy will befall only upon the disbelievers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or desire they to outwit? The unbelievers, they are the outwitted.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Seek they to lay a plot? Then those who disbelieve it is they who shall be plotted against.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or do they intend a plot (against you O Muhammad SAW)? But those who disbelieve (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism) are themselves in a plot!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or are they planning a conspiracy? The conspiracy will befall the disbelievers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or are they contriving a stratagem against you? If so, that stratagem will rebound against the unbelievers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or do they intend a plot But those who disbelieve are themselves plotted against!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or seek they to ensnare (the messenger)? But those who disbelieve, they are the ensnared!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they seek to outmaneuver [Allah]? But it is the faithless who are the outmaneuvered ones!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do they desire to outwit? The unbelievers are the outwitted.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disbelieve - they are the object of a plan.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they design evil plans? The disbelievers themselves will be snared by their evil plots.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or do they desire a war? But those who disbelieve shall be the vanquished ones in war.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am yureedoona kaydan faallatheena kafaroo humu almakeedoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they want to hatch some plot? Those who deny the truth will be the victims of the plot.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or do they intend a plot (against thee)? But those who defy Allah are themselves involved in a Plot!

verses.text: أَمْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ إِلٰهٌ‌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ‌ سُبْحَانَ‌ اللَّهِ‌ عَمَّا يُشْرِکُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا آنان را معبودی جز خداست؟ خدا از آنچه شریک او قرار می دهند، منزّه است. ….

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا آنها را خدايى است جز خداى يكتا؟ منزه است خداى يكتا از هر چه شريكش مى‌سازند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا ايشان را جز خدا معبودى است؟ منزه است خداى يگانه از آنچه شريك او مى‌سازند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا ايشان را جز خدا معبودى است؟ منزّه است خدا از آنچه [با او] شريك مى‌گردانند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا بر آنها خدایی جز خدای یکتا هست؟ که خدا از هر چه شرک و شریک او گیرند پاک و منزه است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که (آنان خیال می‌کنند که) معبودی (و حامی و یاوری) جز خدا دارند؟ خدا پاک و منزّه از چیزهائی است که انبازش می‌دانند و می‌خوانند. [[«أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلهٌ ...»: (نگا: حجر / 96).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر ایشان را خدایی غیر از خداوند است، منزه است خداوند از شریکی که می‌انگارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا معبودی غیر خداوند دارند (که قول یاری به آنها داده)؟! منزّه است خدا از آنچه همتای او قرارمی‌دهند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا ایشان را است خدائی بجز خدا منزّه است خدا از آنچه شرک می‌ورزند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر آنان را خدايى جز خداى يگانه است؟! پاك است خداى از آنچه [با او] انباز مى‌گيرند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا ایشان را جز خدا معبودی است‌؟ منزّه است خدا از آنچه (با او) شریک می‌گیرند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they have a god apart from God? He is too exalted for what they associate with Him!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or do they have a God besides Allah? Purity is to Allah from their ascribing of partners to Him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or have they a god, other than God? Glory be to God, above that which they associate!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is theirs a god beside Allah? Hallowed be Allah from that which they associate!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or have they an ilah (a god) other than Allah? Glorified be Allah from all that they ascribe as partners (to Him)

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they have a god besides God? God transcends what they associate.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do they have any god other than Allah? Exalted be Allah above whatever they associate (with Him in His Divinity).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or have they a god other than Allah Glorified be Allah from all that they ascribe as partners.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or have they any god beside Allah? Glorified be Allah from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him)!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they have any god other than Allah? Clear is Allah of any partners that they may ascribe [to Him]!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do they have a god, other than Allah? Exaltations to Allah above that which they associate!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or have they a deity other than Allah? Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they have another god besides God? God is too exalted to be considered equal to the idols.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have they a god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah from what they set up (with Him).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am lahum ilahun ghayru Allahi subhana Allahi AAamma yushrikoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Or have they a god other than God? Exalted be God over what they ascribe as partners [to Him]!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or have they a god other than Allah? Exalted is Allah far above the things they associate with Him!

verses.text: وَ إِنْ‌ يَرَوْا کِسْفاً مِنَ‌ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطاً يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ‌ مَرْکُومٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر پاره سنگی در حال سقوط از آسمان ببینند [فکر نمی کنند عذاب است، بلکه چنان بر انکار حق اصرار دارند که] می گویند: ابری متراکم است!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر بنگرند كه قطعه‌اى از آسمان فرومى‌افتد، مى‌گويند: ابرى است متراكم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر پاره سنگى را در حال سقوط از آسمان بينند [باز ايمان نياورند و] گويند: ابرى متراكم است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر پاره‌سنگى را در حال سقوط از آسمان ببينند مى‌گويند: «ابرى متراكم است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این کافران اگر هم سقوط قطعه‌ای از آسمان را به چشم ببینند باز خواهند گفت: این پاره ابری متراکم است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر بنگرند که قطعه‌ای از آسمان فرو می‌افتد، می‌گویند: ابر متراکمی است. [[«کِسْفاً»: پاره. تکه. قطعه. «مَرْکُومٌ»: متراکم. «إِن یَرَوْا کِسْفاً»: مراد این است که مشرکان و منکران لجوج، آن چنان در عناد و دشمنی با پیغمبر و اسلام، پافشاری می‌کنند که اگر عذابی را که تمسخرکنان از پیغمبر خواسته بودند (نگا: اسراء / 92) با چشم سر نزول آن را بالای سر خود ببینند، قبول نمی‌کنند و چیز دیگری قلمداد می‌نمایند (نگا: حجر / 14 و 15، احقاف / 24).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون پاره‌ای از آسمان را افتاده بینند، گویند ابری متراکم [و نعمت‌] است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها (چنان لجوجند که) اگر ببینند قطعه سنگی از آسمان (برای عذابشان) سقوط می‌کند می‌گویند: «این ابر متراکمی است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر بینند پاره‌ای را از آسمان فرودآینده گویند ابری است انبوه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر ببينند كه پاره‌اى از آسمان فرو مى‌افتد [باز هم ايمان نيارند و] گويند: ابرى است توده شده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر پاره‌هایی از ابر سیاه را در حال سقوط از آسمان ببینند گویند: «ابری متراکم است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If they should see a segment falling from the sky, they would say: "It is only a massive cloud."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And were they to see a portion of the sky falling, they will say, “It is a heap of clouds.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Even if they saw lumps falling from heaven, they would say, 'A massed cloud!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And if they should see a fragment of the heaven falling down, they would say: it is only clouds piled up.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And if they were to see a piece of the heaven falling down, they would say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Even if they were to see lumps of the sky falling down, they would say, “A mass of clouds.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (So obstinate are they that) even if they were to see some fragments of the sky falling down they would still say: “It is only a mass of cloud.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And if they were to see a piece of the heaven falling down, they would say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And if they were to see a fragment of the heaven falling, they would say: A heap of clouds.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Were they to see a fragment falling from the sky, they would say, ‘A cumulous cloud.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Even if they saw lumps falling from the sky they would say: 'A massed cloud'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling, they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Even if they were to see a part of the heavens falling down upon them, they would say, "It is only dense cloud".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And if they should see a portion of the heaven coming down, they would say: Piled up clouds.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wain yaraw kisfan mina alssamai saqitan yaqooloo sahabun markoomun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If they should see a part of the heavens falling down, they would say, "A mass of clouds,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Were they to see a piece of the sky falling (on them), they would (only) say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"

verses.text: فَذَرْهُمْ‌ حَتَّى‌ يُلاَقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ‌ الَّذِي‌ فِيهِ‌ يُصْعَقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [اکنون که با هیچ دلیلی هدایت نمی شوند] پس آنان را واگذار تا آن روزشان را که در آن هلاک می شوند، ببینند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس آنها را واگذار تا روزى را كه در آن به هلاكت مى‌رسند بنگرند؛

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس آنها را رها كن تا روز مرگ خود را كه بيهوش مى‌افتند ملاقات كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس بگذارشان تا به آن روزى كه در آن بيهوش مى‌افتند برسند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اینان را به (جهل) خود رها کن تا به روز سختشان که آن روز یکسر بیهوش و هلاک می‌شوند عاقبت برسند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس ایشان را به حال خود واگذار، تا برسند به روزی که در آن هلاک می‌گردند. [[«یُصْعَقُونَ»: نابود گردانده می‌شوند. هلاک می‌گردند. مراد فرا رسیدن مرگ ایشان در جنگ یا به هنگام اجل است. از مصدر إصعاق به معنی إهلاک است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس ایشان را رها کن تا روز خاصشان را که در آن بیهوش کرده شوند، دیدار کنند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: حال که چنین است آنها را رها کن تا روز مرگ خود را ملاقات کنند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بگذارشان تا برسند به روزشان که در آن به صاعقه سوزند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس واگذارشان تا آن روزشان را ببينند كه در آن به بيهوشى مرگ افتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بگذارشان تا به آن روزشان که در آن بیهوش می‌افتند برسند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So, leave them until they face their day (of doom) when they will be stunned.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore leave them, until they confront their day, in which they will be stunned.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then leave them, till they encounter their day wherein they shall be thunderstruck,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore let them alone, till they meet their Day whereon they shall swoon.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So leave them alone till they meet their Day, in which they will sink into a fainting (with horror).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be stunned.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs when they shall be struck down,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So leave them alone till they meet their Day, in which they will sink into a fainting (with horror).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then let them be (O Muhammad), till they meet their day, in which they will be thunder-stricken,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So leave them until they encounter the day when they will be thunderstruck,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So leave them till they encounter their Day in which they shall be thunderstruck.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: So leave them alone until they face the day when they will be struck dead from terror

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Leave them then till they meet that day of theirs wherein they shall be made to swoon (with terror):

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fatharhum hatta yulaqoo yawmahumu allathee feehi yusAAaqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: so leave them alone till they face the Day on which they will be struck dumb,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs, wherein they shall (perforce) swoon (with terror),-

verses.text: يَوْمَ‌ لاَ يُغْنِي‌ عَنْهُمْ‌ کَيْدُهُمْ‌ شَيْئاً وَ لاَ هُمْ‌ يُنْصَرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: روزی که نیرنگشان چیزی از عذاب را از آنان دفع نمی کند و یاری هم نخواهند شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: روزى كه مكرشان هيچ به حالشان سود نكند و كس به ياريشان برنخيزد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: روزى كه تدبيرشان به هيچ وجه به كارشان نيايد و ايشان يارى نشوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: روزى كه نيرنگشان به هيچ‌وجه به كارشان نيايد و حمايت نيابند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن روزی که مکر و تدبیرشان هیچ به کارشان نیاید و هیچ کس یاریشان نکند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن روزی که نیرنگها و توطئه‌هایشان سودی به حالشان نخواهد داشت، و (از هیچ سوئی) مدد و یاری نمی‌شوند. [[«کَیْدُهُمْ»: نیرنگ ایشان. نقشه‌های سوء و توطئه‌های کثیفشان. حیله‌گریهایشان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: روزی که نیرنگشان به کار آنان نیاید و یاری نیابند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: روزی که نقشه‌های آنان سودی به حالشان نخواهد داشت و (از هیچ سو) یاری نمی‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: روزی که بی‌نیاز نگرداند از ایشان نیرنگشان چیزی را و نه یاری شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: روزى كه نيرنگ و ترفندشان آنان را هيچ سود نكند و يارى نشوند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روزی که نیرنگشان به هیچ وجه به کارشان نیاید و نه آنان حمایت می‌شوند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Their deception will not avail them in the least on that day, nor will they be helped.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: A day on which their scheming will not benefit them at all, nor will they be helped.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: the day when their guile shall avail them naught, and they shall not be helped.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: A Day whereon their plotting will avail them not at all, nor will they be succoured.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The Day when their plotting shall not avail them at all nor will they be helped (i.e. they will receive their torment in Hell).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The Day when their ploys will avail them nothing; and they will not be helped.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: when their stratagem shall be of no avail to them, nor shall they be succoured.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The Day when their plotting shall not avail them at all, nor will they be helped.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A day in which their guile will naught avail them, nor will they be helped.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
